result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo L Phipps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 4-1-15 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

Huber privileges for work, AODA treatment , and for the Day Reporting Center. Court notes an objection to electronic monitoring. Court STAYED the sentence to 9-15-14 at 8:15am. 

Court advised the defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advises the defendant may not possess or use any illegally controlled substance or alcohol as it forfeits the release privileges.

****ORDER;  RELEASE PRIVILEGES IS GRANTED only if he participates and  in part fully complies with DRC center program and no sooner than January 4, 2015...Electronic monitoring but not before January 4th, 2015, dated 12/19/2014 Judge Stark****
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorenzo L Phipps

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Order, signed and filed. 
The defendant's request for release privileges is granted, in part only if he participates and fully complies with the Day Reporting Center Program, and NO sooner than January 4, 2015. Defendant may be release for the following: Electronic Monitoring, to start no sooner than January 4, 2015. No electronic monitoring before 1-4-2015.
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on GPS.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   
Court ordered defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges for work, AODA treatment, and for the Day Reporting Center. Court notes an objection to electronic monitoring. Court STAYED the sentence to 9-15-2014 at 8:15 a.m., Br. 17.  Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 04-01-2015 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court. 
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  


COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Court advises the defendant may not possess or use any illegally controlled substance or alcohol as it forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

  Calendar call scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 8, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-09-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Case held over from the a.m.; court in jury trial this date.  Case has been accepted by the drug treatment court.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-23-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states the Defendant is an appropriate candidate for the Drug Treatment Court. Defendant has been pre screened, and is eligible with a possible DPA. However, there is a backlog on staffing. Defense requesting a plea hearing. No objection from State. Court grant request. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Report from Empathetic Counseling Services received and filed with court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps not in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne A Devitt appeared for the defense.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-10-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-15-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.
State turns over discovery to the defense.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Lorenzo L Phipps in custody.   Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
